creditline: The Curtis Dunnavan Asian Art Fund
description: celadon green bowl; lightly incised organic design at interior; small foot
medium: Yaozhou ware Stoneware with carved decor under a green glaze
text: Potted at the Yaozhou kilns in Shanxi province, this bowl has a grooved rim and the interior is finely carved with two carnellia blossoms and an orchid-like flower in profile all encircled by leafy branches. The bowl is covered overall with a crackled sea-green glaze which shades to a deeper tone where it has pooled in the carved recesses. The neatly cut footrim is treated with a light brown wash which is typical of many Yaozhou celadons.
title: Bowl
